ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Subscription Problems
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, according to press release it s over 175,000 which means it s less than 180,000 Could the recent snafu s by Verant be impacting the number of
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, according to press release it's "over 175,000" which means it's
less than 180,000

Could the recent snafu's by Verant be impacting the number of people still
playing?

Could announcing server splits 24 hours before they're going to happen be
driving people insane with anger and causing them to quit permanently?

Could arbitrarily assigning coin only loot to a pvp server have pissed some
customers off to the point they quit?

hmmmmmm

makes ya wonder ;)

Last month the official releases were "Over 200,000 registered users". So
roughly 25,000 people quit this month......

Thoughts to ponder.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 24, 2000 3:23 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Subscription Problems


> 200,000 people are subscribed to EQ (approx.) Over 2 million copies of
> Final Fantasy have been sold. Not really comparable.
>
> Kit
>
> Um, yes. Everquest is so holy and serious that it would be undignified
and
> crass to make merchandise.
>
> Action figures from a video game? What were they thinking? How DARE they
> profane this sacred video game with fun toys?
>
> I'm gonna pick up my Official Boba Fett pen and write a scathing letter on
> my Star Trek Stationary to those money grubbing game makers!
>
> Right after I put on my Official Darth Vader Helmet so I can get in the
> mood.
>
> Golias the Shocked
>
> ---------------
>
>
AAAAAAAAAAAAAaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
>
> !
>
> This is just too wrong for words so I won't even try. What's next EQ
> Boxers???
>
> Kit
>
>
> >Someone please tell me this is a joke...please oh please oh please...
>
